tasks.task: Modify the GitHub Actions workflow file (.github/workflows/python-app.yml) to include a step after artifact creation that runs send_artifact_email.py, passing appropriate arguments and using secrets if available.

Create a Python script named send_artifact_email.py in the repo root. The script should: 1) Check for SMTP email and password in environment variables (SMTP_USERNAME, SMTP_PASSWORD). 2) If present, use those for authentication; otherwise, read them from smtp.json. 3) Zip the HTML artifacts (pis-gr-scraper-html.zip) if not already zipped. 4) Send the zipped file as an attachment to isidora.k1708@gmail.com using SMTP.

Generate smtp.json in the repo root with example fields: { "smtp_server": "smtp.gmail.com", "smtp_port": 465, "smtp_username": "your_email@gmail.com", "smtp_password": "your_password", "receiver": "isidora.k1708@gmail.com" }
Provide a guide for the user to add SMTP_USERNAME and SMTP_PASSWORD as secrets in the GitHub repository and ensure the workflow passes these env variables to the Python script.
